text: - Name's Theo.

I'm an Inventory Control
Quality Assurance Specialist.
My journey starts kind of funny.
Got my start in a fulfillment center
as a seasonal associate,

got an opportunity to come
on as a full-time associate.
I kind of outgrew my position
and AWS started screaming to me.
(upbeat music)

So, the FC to DC program
helps you transition
from that fulfillment center background
to the data center day to day.

It's just essentially saying
that, hey, you're from the FC.

We know you don't have
a technical background.
We're willing to work with you.
You're already an Amazonian.
Come on over.

I tell anyone and stuff when
you make that transition

from the fulfillment
center to data center,
it will be rough.
(upbeat music)
I didn't have a data center background.
Didn't know what a server rack was.
Didn't know how to enter a data center.
Didn't know what fiber was.
Once you get out here, we can train you up
and show you that stuff.
They will invest in you.
Pay for school through Amazon Career Choice for hourly Amazonians.

They'll pay for you to
actually get certified.
(upbeat music)
I'm thinking about dabbling

and getting a degree in web
design on Amazon's dollar
and they'll Pay for school through Amazon Career Choice for hourly Amazonians.
So, if they're investing in you,
you might as well invest in yourself.
There's so many opportunities out here

that I did not know
about until I joined AWS.
Here, you can go anywhere.
(upbeat music)
